channel.title: BBC News - Business

item.title: Almost 50 shops a day disappear from High Streets
item.description: Britain's High Streets lost more than 8,700 stores in the first six months of 2021, research suggests.

item.title: Jobs market set for bumpy ride, says Resolution Foundation
item.description: Those still on furlough face uncertain times when the scheme ends, the Resolution Foundation says.

item.title: Covid-19: Pub marquees could become permanent fixtures
item.description: Some of the outdoor seating set up by businesses in the pandemic could be allowed to remain.

item.title: What's it like to be in the 1% of female lorry drivers?
item.description: The chronic shortage of lorry drivers has led haulage firms to try to attract more women to the role.

item.title: Heathrow criticises Border Force for 'unacceptable' queues
item.description: The airport says too few staff were on duty at passport control as families returned from holiday.

item.title: Flu jabs in England and Wales delayed due to HGV driver shortage
item.description: The maker says it is two weeks behind on its deliveries, and vaccinations will have to be rescheduled.

item.title: Hardys wine owner warns of Christmas shortage risk
item.description: The firm behind Echo Falls says continued staff shortages could definitely hit the festive season.

item.title: Covid: Watchdog launches new crackdown on PCR test firms
item.description: One company is under investigation and 19 others could face legal action following complaints.

item.title: Poor US jobs growth shows Covid Delta variant impact
item.description: The US economy added just 235,000 jobs in August, according to the Bureau of Labour Statistics.

item.title: Food price rise fears amid staff shortages
item.description: Wholesalers are facing a "perfect storm" of adverse effects, warns one leading industry figure.

item.title: Buy Now Pay Later: 'I'm stressed over debt'
item.description: One in ten Buy Now Pay Later shoppers have been chased by debt collectors, Citizen's Advice says.

item.title: Councils hit by bin collection delays due to driver shortage
item.description: Some 18 councils across the UK are suffering waste collection delays due to a lack of bin lorry drivers.

item.title: Coin hoarding at home leads to charity plea
item.description: UK residents are hoarding an estimated Â£50m in loose change, according to UK Finance.

item.title: China set to open new stock exchange in Beijing
item.description: The announcement comes as Chinese firms are under intense scrutiny both at home and in the US.

item.title: GM to idle eight North American plants amid chip shortage
item.description: Output will halt at eight plants in the US, Mexico and Canada amid a global shortage of semi-conductors.

item.title: Food production in the UK at risk of moving overseas, warns industry
item.description: A retail group says shortages of drivers and other staff mean the sector is "just on the edge of coping".

item.title: TCS: India's largest private employer returns to office
item.description: IT services giant TCS says it's ready to go back to the office after 18 months - how will that work?

item.title: Amazon offers punctual staff Â£50 for turning up
item.description: The online shopping giant says it will give a bonus to workers at some sites for good attendance.

item.title: China's media cracks down on 'effeminate' styles
item.description: The media regulator says it will shun "vulgar influencers" while casting a spotlight on stars' pay.

item.title: JD Sports perplexed by Footasylum deal knockback
item.description: The competition watchdog says it still has concerns the merger could lead to a worse deal for shoppers.

item.title: Gym Group sees demand surge as young people lack space at home
item.description: Gym Group says it has seen a "rapid recovery" in membership numbers and plans to open 40 more sites.

item.title: Top Gun and Mission: Impossible films delayed due to US Covid spike
item.description: Tom Cruise's movies are put on hold as studios fear a recent US Covid spike will deter cinemagoers.

item.title: 'Bitcoin fraud cost me Â£500,000'
item.description: A successful businessman saw his life savings wiped out when he fell victim to ruthless fraudsters.

item.title: Why picking a good company name is a tricky business
item.description: With the number of new start-ups soaring they all have to choose a name for themselves.

item.title: CEO Secrets: 'I was making money, but had no money'
item.description: Honey boss Scott Davies says cash flow problems meant though he was profitable he "had no money".

item.title: Can apps move the #MeToo movement forward?
item.description: Reporting sexual harassment at work is getting easier thanks to new technologies.

item.title: Japan's huge army of under-employed ex-housewives
item.description: Why women are still battling for better jobs in the world's third largest economy.

item.title: The pubs and restaurants counting on Christmas cheer
item.description: In a bid to rebound from Covid plans for this year's festive season are under way.

item.title: CEO Secrets: 'Tear up the business plan'
item.description: CEO Secrets: Brooklyn Brewery boss Eric Ottaway says - be ready to ditch your business plan.
